Series.Actors: |Jason Ritter|Kristen Schaal|Alex Hirsch|Jennifer Coolidge|Jessica DiCicco|J. K. Simmons|Carl Faruolo|Dee Bradley Baker|Niki Yang|Thurop Van Orman|Jackie Buscarino|T. J. Miller|Grey DeLisle|Keith Ferguson|Kevin Michael Richardson|Linda Cardellini|Cecil Baldwin|Dave Wittenberg|Gregg Turkington|Justin Roiland|Louis C.K.|Matt Chapman|Nick Offerman|Will Forte|
Series.Overview: Twin brother and sister Dipper and Mabel Pines are in for an unexpected adventure when they spend the summer helping their Great Uncle Stan run a tourist trap in the mysterious town of Gravity Falls, Oregon.

Episode.EpisodeName: Candy Monster (Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained)
Episode.Overview: Dipper and Mabel must battle a monster who takes their Summerween candy.

Episode.EpisodeName: Stan's Tattoo (Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained)
Episode.Overview: Dipper devises a plan to unravel the enigma that is Stan’s tattoo.
Dipper and Soos stumble upon a mailbox in the middle of the forest and make it their mission to discover who (or what) picks up the mail left inside.
Dipper sets out to discover why a certain Gravity Falls resident always faces left.
Dipper and Mabel find a gigantic tooth on the shores of the lake, and set out in a rowboat to find out where it came from.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Hide Behind (Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained)
Episode.Overview: After hearing rumors of a local lumberjack legend, Dipper investigates a mysterious creature that has been heard, but never seen.
Mabel gives her thoughts on dating and puts her dating quiz to the test with three of Gravity Falls’ most eligible bachelors — Grunkle Stan, Dipper and Soos.
Mabel gives her unique perspective on the history of stickers, their many styles and uses.
Mabel reveals her fashion secrets to the world, including FLASH MAKEOVERS!
Mabel’s survey into everyone’s favorite colors causes a color emergency when she learns Grunkle Stan has never seen a rainbow.
Mabel reveals that her gift of art has driven her to genius level with the creation of her own personal art movement — the “Caticature.”
Soos fixes up the golf cart so that Dipper and Wendy can perform a stunt.
Soos fixes up a Cuckoo Clock and gives it an ultra-awesome remodel.

Mabel watches the public television of Gravity Falls. On the television she finds a Mystery Shack TV commercial, some words by Soos, and footage of Gideon in the prison, which appears to be a sort of reality show about his interaction with fellow inmates.
Grunkle Stan watches Ducktective, Teenz Talk, and Why you ackin so cray cray.
Mabel recalls the Pines' eleborate plan to break into a movie theatre.
Mabel remembers when the family visited a petting zoo.

Episode.EpisodeName: Government Agency (Old Man McGucket's Conspiracy Corner)
The Ice Man (Old Man McGucket's Conspiracy Corner)
Laptop Code (Old Man McGucket's Conspiracy Corner)
Relationship Shipping (Old Man McGucket's Conspiracy Corner)
Stan's Brother (Old Man McGucket's Conspiracy Corner)
Jar of Eyes (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Aztec Calendar (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Fez (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Deer Teeth (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Mystery Box (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
UFO on a String (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Nacho Necklace (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Outtakes (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)
Diving Helmet (Shop at Home with Mr. Mystery)

Episode.Overview: Hosted by creator Alex Hirsch and Gravity Falls character Time Baby. The special elaborates on the production of the show, giving fans an inside look behind the scenes.

Episode.EpisodeName: Cease and Desist (Creepy Letters from Lil Gideon)
Episode.Overview: Lil Gideon writes to Mabel and things get weird.
Lil Gideon writes Mabel once again.
Lil Gideon writes to the people of Gravity Falls wishing the love and forgiveness.
Lil Gideon writes the Pines family letting them know they are always in his thoughts, and other places.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dipper Tickle (Creepy Letters from Lil Gideon)
Episode.Overview: Lil Gideon writes to Dipper to offer up an apology...or not.
Welcome to Sweater-Town. Land of the best Mabel sweaters ever!
Celebrate the Weirdpocalypse with the weirdest monsters of Gravity Falls.

In 2010 recent CalArts grad Alex Hirsch pitched "Gravity Falls" to the Disney Channel. He wrote and drew the storyboard entirely on post-it notes and a rushed pilot was commissioned by Disney to a small low budget flash animation studio in Canada.
This rough in-house "pilot" Disney produced, though ultimately in a very different style and never fully "finished", shows us the very first ever glimpse of Dipper & Mabel.
Unsatisfied with the look and style of this pilot, Alex Hirsch personally hired his own team when the show was greenlit to series.

When Dipper and Mabel Pines arrive to spend their summer break in the remote town of Gravity Falls, Mabel’s suspiciously weird new boyfriend causes the twins to come face to face with the town’s strange and uncanny secrets.
When Dipper and Mabel hear rumors of a sea monster that lives at the bottom of the local lake, they enlist Soos to take them on a boating expedition to prove it really does exist.
When someone tampers with Mabel's life-size wax statue of Grunkle Stan, she and Dipper set out to find the culprit. Meanwhile, Grunkle Stan mourns over the loss of his wax doppelganger.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Hand That Rocks the Mabel
Episode.Overview: Dipper and Mabel discover that their seemingly cherubic new neighbor, Lil' Gideon, happens to be the town's adored psychic. But when Lil' Gideon guilts her into dating him, she and Dipper soon learn that his cuteness can fade all too quickly.
Dipper is invited by Wendy and her teen friends on a trek that leads to an abandoned convenience store that may be haunted.

In a quest to attain manliness, Dipper ventures into the forest to battle the notorious Multi-Bear. Meanwhile, Mabel tries to teach Grunkle Stan how to be attractive to women, particularly the waitress in the local diner, Lazy Susan.
Stan throws a big weekend party to promote the Mystery Shack. Dipper makes clones of himself to impress Wendy. Mabel fights for the Party Queen title in honor of her two friends.
When Dipper and Mabel discover evidence that the reported town founder is a hoax, they set out to expose the historical cover-up and prove that Mabel's silliness is not a bad thing.
Dipper wants to correct a mistake he made in the past with assistance from a time machine. Mabel is overjoyed when she wins a pet pig at a fair.

After being challenged to a fight by Wendy's boyfriend Robbie, Dipper is shocked when his favorite Fight Fighters fighter, Rumble McSkirmish, comes to life to defend him, but Dipper soon loses control of Rumble and has to find a way to stop him from seriously injuring Robbie
Dipper is self-conscious that Mabel is taller than him and seeks a magic solution. Meanwhile Lil' Gideon takes advantage of Dipper's and Mabel's height discrepancy.
Dipper and Mabel go trick-or-treating in the summer and encounter a candy-loving monster who threatens to devour them if they don't bring him sweet things to eat.
Mabel bets Grunkle Stan that she will make more money at the Mystery Shack by treating people nicely than he does by being rude and cranky.
While Stan, Dipper, Mabel and Soos are falling in a bottomless pit, they tell stories to pass the time.
When Mabel befriends a cute merman trapped in the public pool, she's determined to help him out. Meanwhile, Dipper decides to volunteer as a lifeguard to see Wendy.
The twins discover a hidden room inside the Mystery Shack and compete over who should have it.

When Mabel discovers that her favorite boy band is actually a bunch of imprisoned clones, she sets them free, only to decide on keeping them for herself. Meanwhile, Dipper is convinced that Robbie plans to brainwash Wendy with a secret message hidden inside one of his songs.
When Waddles is snatched by a prehistoric beast, Dipper, Mabel, Stan, Soos, and Old Man McGucket must journey to a mysterious land trapped in time to rescue him.
Dipper, Mabel, and Soos must travel through Grunkle Stan's mind to defeat a tricky dream demon summoned by Lil Gideon.

Li'l Gideon swindles the Mystery Shack away, forcing Grunkle Stan and the kids to move in with Soos. While Stan weighs how he can still care for his grandniece and nephew, they decide to take on Gideon.
The Pines family is starting to get everything back to normal after the Lil' Gideon incident. They throw a “Mystery Shack Is Back” party, but some unwelcome guests intend to crash it.
Dipper’s secret journal pages lead him and the gang to the author’s hidden bunker where they find themselves face-to-face with a mysterious figure from Gravity Falls’ lore.

Episode.GuestStars: |Patton Oswalt|Nathan Fillion|John O'Hurley|Jim Cummings|John Roberts|Greg Cipes|
Episode.Overview: After being belittled by Pacifica one too many times, Mabel challenges her to a miniature golf-off which gets a tad out of control when some local residents offer their help.
Mabel decides to put on a sock puppet rock opera to impress a local puppeteer, but her show goes awry when Dipper's drive to uncover more of the journal's secrets leads to a supernatural disaster.
Soos needs a date for his cousin Reggie's engagement party and looks to a dating simulator game to help him talk to girls.

In three separate mysterious tales, Stan is cursed by a Witch, Waddles accidentally eats a bowl of brain-enhancing jelly and builds a machine that allows him to speak, and Mabel faces her fear of claymation.
The kids, along with Old Man McGucket's help, discover there is a secret society in Gravity Falls.
Blendin returns to face off with Dipper and Mabel in a futuristic battle that could trap them forever in time jail.
Mabel takes matchmaking too far when she steals a love potion from a real Love God.

Episode.GuestStars: |Kevin Michael Richardson|Kari Wahlgren|Nick Offerman|Will Forte|Nathan Fillion|
Episode.Overview: Pacifica enlists Dipper’s help to rid the Northwest Mansion of a ghost before he wreaks havoc on her fancy party.
After agents Powers and Trigger take Stan into custody, Dipper and Mabel begin to wonder how much they actually know about their Grunkle Stan.
Cornered underneath the Mystery Shack, Stan must finally reveal the secrets of his past and his mysterious portal to Dipper and Mabel.
Dipper finds an unlikely friend to join him with his newest obsession — a board game called “Dungeons, Dungeons, and More Dungeons.”
When Grunkle Stan decides to run for mayor, Dipper and Mabel have their work cut out for them trying to turn their gaffe-prone uncle into the perfect candidate.
A new threat leads Mabel to venture into the enchanted realm of the unicorns. Meanwhile, Dipper learns an unexpected twist about the enigmatic Bill Cipher.
Grunkle Stan takes the kids with him on a road-trip to sabotage all the other tourist traps in Oregon.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dipper and Mabel vs. the Future
Episode.Overview: Mabel decides to plan for her and Dipper's 13th birthday party. Meanwhile, Dipper and Ford venture below the town to find its most shocking secret.

Episode.GuestStars: |Louis C.K.|Danielle Fishel|Patrick McHale|Andy Merrill|Brian Bloom|Nathan Fillion|Justin Roiland|Dave Wittenberg|J. K. Simmons|
Episode.Overview: Trapped in the apocalypse and menaced by villains new and old, Dipper finds himself in a race against time.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jon Stewart|John Roberts|Greg Cipes|Danielle Fishel|Patrick McHale|Eric Bauza|Alfred Molina|
Episode.Overview: Dipper, Soos and Wendy must save Mabel from a strange new world, while Bill's forces plan their next move.

Episode.GuestStars: |Louis C.K.|Danielle Fishel|Cecil Baldwin|Kyle MacLachlan|Andy Merrill|Nathan Fillion|J. K. Simmons|Larry King|
Episode.Overview: In the series finale, the Mystery Shack crew and townsfolk fight against Bill Cipher and his minions in a final stand to defeat them once and for all and save the town of Gravity Falls and the world.
